channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Car parked across pavement, 28th July
item.description:
For months, the residents of 65 Slades Hill have used the pavement outside their house as car parking space. Multiple times a week, especially at weekends, they park their cars so they block either the footway, or the cycle lane, or both. This has been reported before but nothing has been done

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 67, Enfield Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Top of dead tree removed, however, lower section and root still in place, 28th July
item.description:
The upper section of the tree has been removed, however, lower section and roots need to be removed and perhaps a new tree planted. Many thanks Mr James 30 Merewood
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 30, Merewood Road, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drain cover + insert on the side of the road, 28th July
item.description:
Somebody has dumped a large metal drain plus concrete insert on side of road. This could potentially injure cyclists or damage vehicles

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 93, Penge Road, Anerley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 226 Grafton Road/ Cressfield Close, 28th July
item.description:
The CCTV camera is pointing upwards to the sky and not to the road. As a result, the CCTV camera is not enforcing traffic restrictions on Grafton Road. The sign under the camera states this is ‘operated by Camden Council’ so can you please stop replying that this is not the Council’s responsibility. Escalated to local Cllr due to your pathetic responses.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Cressfield Close, Gospel Oak, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is dropping fruit, 28th July
item.description:
This trees on this road is dropping fruit all Over the pavement and it’s a tripping hazard as well as creating a mess on the pavement and floor. The trees fruit also stains cars. Can this mess please be cleared and perhaps trim the trees also?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 33, Ashley Road, Archway, London

item.title: Flyposted cards on bus shelter southbound in Anerley Rd, opp Anerley Town Hall, 28th July
item.description:
Postcard size flyposting for an event and the host location on the bus shelter southbound in Anerley Rd opposite side of the road from Anerley Town Hall for (a) SE19 Summertime Event at St Paul's Church, Hamlet Rd, and (b) Anerley Team Ministry tel: 020 8778 7014 admin@anerleyteamministry.org.uk These cards are also flyposted on many other bus shelters locally (seen from moving bus)

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 127, Anerley Road, Crystal Palace, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Graffiti / Flyposting on stop or shelter (non-offensive)

item.title: Unsafe Overhanging Shrubs, 28th July
item.description:
Several places along Edith Nesbitt Walk where overhanging shrubs are causing a safety issue. The walk is a permitted cycle path. The low hanging foliage and branches are very difficult to avoid when cycling. The Walk also has weeds spreading across the width of the pathway.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rochester Way Relief Road, Well Hall, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hedges need trimming, 28th July
item.description:
The edges either side of the steps that lead from The Palace down to the lawn need trimming as do the two larger bushes at the top. The hedges that surround the rose beds also need cutting back and all need ‘squaring’ and tidying up. Thanks.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rochester Avenue, Widmore, London
